nodes.bodyText: should this be beforeall instead of beforeeach? Doesn't really seem necessary to upload for every test (even though it won't actually upload because it will already exist)
That's an option. I was trying to reuse the cms client in kernel so couldn't make it in beforeall. But this should be easy to change.
same here.
Also, should we be deleting the packages when the test completes?
delete api is not implemented yet. We don't have a way to delete the components. Is it ok to leave these artifacts in test accounts for now?
I think the delete API exists though. Even if it doesn't do anything; I'd add the code to delete it now, that way we can't forget to add it.
remove the todo
Still applies as delete api is not available for cleanup. (the delete request in aftereach is not actually doing anything)
Can you change the string to be "implementers" since that is the proper spelling anyway?
will do
doesn't this request need to include the platforms too? Or is is just the recipe only?
The request does not include platforms. The recipe should have a "Platforms" key with a list of supported platforms.
move this inside the try, then you don't need to pre-declare length.
why are you wrapping this with a list? It already is a list.
Without this change, ln112 packageMetadataList.addAll will throw UnsupportedOperationException

Nit - While this helps us consolidate all interactions with component management service behind a facade, I would prefer if code that is only used by tests stays in test utils, it will prevent any misunderstandings, and we will be able to only package what we really want to ship as part of the executables. When we eventually move E2E tests out of the current repository, we will need to remember to clean this up

nodes.bodyText: Good point. I put it in prod code for now in case we want to keep the eg CLI functionality to promote packages and deployments. Currenlty CLI initializes new clients with creds required. Since we have a client in the kernel, I was thinking we can channel back the promote request from CLI and make the service call in kernel.

nodes.bodyText: Let's add a SIM for this. We really need a lot more tests here. And, by "this" I mean the package manager.
can you remove the duplicate from L43 now?

           name: Failed Test Report

+        with:

+          path: target/jacoco-report

nodes.bodyText:
are you sure the continue on error is wanted?
if: always() makes sense, but I'm not sure about this one because it will continue to run the subsequent tasks.

nodes.bodyText: Yes there're 2 steps afterwards, cobertura-report and benchmark test compile. cobertura-report will mostly likely fail if the upload step fails. There's no harm to continue with the benchmark test compile though
